definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: We never made a purchase on credit.
She was never flighty like you.
sentences.chinese: 她从来不像你这样胡思乱想。

sentences.english: Chinese people has never regarded human beings as the hightest creature among everything else since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 中华民族自古以来从来不把人看作高于一切。

sentences.english: Those are only our decoration, coz we never follow the money.
sentences.chinese: 那只是偶们的装饰品，偶们从来不会被钱奴役。

sentences.english: The path has never been perfect.
sentences.chinese: 道路从来不可能总是平坦的通途。

sentences.english: Right. I have witnessed some applications that in fact rarely or never throw exceptions.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我知道有些应用程序极少或从来不会抛出异常。

sentences.english: The window is never open except in summer.
sentences.chinese: 这扇窗户从来不开，夏季除外。

sentences.english: He has no co ectio or acce to useful information.
sentences.chinese: 他从来不运用或接触有用的资讯。

sentences.english: The sitcom single woman is never alone for long.
sentences.chinese: 情景喜剧中的单身女人从来不会独身很久的。

sentences.english: Such things are never talked about in businese circles.
sentences.chinese: 商业界的人士从来不谈论这种事。

sentences.english: Tyler never ate in restaurants, and Marla wasn't wrinkled.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒从来不在餐馆里吃饭，而马拉也没有长皱纹。

sentences.english: She never uses it on workers, drones, or people.
sentences.chinese: 她从来不用她的螫针去剌工蜂，雄蜂，或人。

sentences.english: His wife never cooks for him.
A person that does not get online, often inspect a network to be great scourges .
sentences.chinese: 一个从来不上网的人，常常视网络为洪水猛兽。

sentences.english: For it is just as when I feed myself – I don't expect to be rewarded.
sentences.chinese: 就像自己给自己喂饭一样，从来不会希求回馈或善报。

sentences.english: He is a very good husband and never runs around on his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他是个模范丈夫，从来不会瞒着妻子做一切事情。

definition: always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
in no way/not in the least/absolutely not
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
